definition: (cry of encouragement)/to arise/to stand up/to gain the ascendancy/Come on!
male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Thinks that he will hold up again this year.
sentences.chinese: 認爲他今年會再次雄起。

sentences.english: China long live, Olympic Games refuel, Sichuan rises.
sentences.chinese: 中國萬歲，奧運加油，四川雄起。

sentences.english: You are also seeing a pickup in equipment and software investments.
sentences.chinese: 設備和軟件投資又重新雄起。
肯尼亞衰落，烏干達雄起。

sentences.english: We are the hunter class and qq will block out the forums.
sentences.chinese: 我們是獵人，我們要在論壇雄起。

sentences.english: Come on Yao, how do you get blocked there?
sentences.chinese: 雄起，姚明，你怎麼能遭到這樣的封蓋呢？

sentences.english: Chinese people will one day rise up against their own oppressive regime.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民終有一天會雄起於其專制制度。

sentences.english: But domestic brand day by day male, wrestles the most landscape.
sentences.chinese: 而國內品牌日益雄起，搏得大半個江山。

definition: to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
vigor/virility/dynamism/(literary) powerful wind
to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to rise vigorously/a spirited start
to stand firm/to stand one's ground (in the face of adversity or pain)
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
to revitalize/to restore (prestige, prosperity etc)/revival/recovery
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts

to revive/to rejuvenate
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
lit. to reorganize flags and drums (idiom); to regroup after a setback/to prepare for new initiatives/to attempt a comeback
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to bestir oneself/to pull oneself together/to cheer up/to uplift/to stimulate
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
